reviews_data.review_text: Unimpressive. Skip it.

My delivery order from here was a disgrace and this review is based solely on the food quality and not a service or dine-in experience.  We ordered two breakfast sandwiches from here yesterday: the avocado toast with bacon and egg added and an egg, cheddar, and avocado sandwich with onions and pesto. Both sandwiches were missing avocado, which is an extra charge, including the AVOCADO TOAST. How does that happen? Not to mention that my $10.50 croissant sandwich was so pathetic and essentially an open face sandwich with one small piece of croissant and a sad portion of egg and cheese smooshed together that I mistook for the other side of the bread. It looks like I ordered an onion and pesto sandwich. The key lime pie was sizable and good.  Seems food quality and poor service are an issue at this location based on other reviews so we definitely will not be wasting money here again.

I come here early in the a.m. sometimes after working 3rd shift. Usually right after they open, as i get off at 7am. Staff is just friendly enough for such an early hour and polite. They seem to get along with each other and have fun, but they still prioritize the customer and greet you and smile when you walk in.  Pastries here are always good except SOMETIMES the classic croissant seems well-done for my taste. Vanilla sugar roll is delicious every time.  I like to order a soy latte, sometimes plain and sometimes with mocha or caramel added. Espresso flavor is always smooth and the milk and foam are always just right.  I'm usually in and out, and if it might take a while they warn me and apologize for the wait.  I wish i lived closer!
Fantastic bakery. We love it and will continue to go there often.
They don't have the Vanilla Sugar Roll anymore and it physically hurts, otherwise I love this place so much 😩

Omg! The sunnys special breakfast sandwich is literally the best sandwich ive ever had. I add bacon and cheddar..i have been a weekly buyer for over 2 years with a awesome cup of coffee..when i have a sweet tooth i get the cinnamon  bun..i post thid when i dont review places normally because i feel the need to make sure you dont sleep on them..they are legit

I want to love this place (I really do), but after visiting several times I always leave thinking I overpaid, feeling the service is quite awful, and wishing I went elsewhere.  Sunflour has quite possibly the best muffins in Charlotte, but that's all that would warrant a higher review.  The service leaves a lot to be desired with staff that never seems happy, and wait times that are hard to justify for coffee or baked goods.  The bread used on their sandwiches is always great, but the rest usually lacks flavor and any moisture.  To ensure it's not dry, it would need mustard (a 50 cents add on), or multiple condiments... otherwise, be sure you have water on hand.  I've tried this place for years and unfortunately it has lost its local bakery neighborhood feel as the goal seems to be expansion while compromising on service and taste.

Hit or miss on order accuracy.  Eat in no issues. To go orders wrong or missing sandwiches both times.  Perhaps people were too busy being cool for accuracy. Food quality is very good when order is right.

Sunflour is one of my favorite cafes in Charlotte. Their coffee is delightfully smooth every time and their bakery items are huge and delicious! I tired the Forager breakfast sandwich today and it was excellent. The truffle aioli really came through and paired well with the goat cheese and mushrooms. We also tried an egg and bacon cheddar biscuit, which was also tasty. I think the biscuit itself was the star of the show. Great place for coffee and breakfast :)
Orders are rarely accurate. Long waits. Disorganized staff.  They have some high quality baked items. But anything else is a mess.

Waited over 40 minutes for 2 breakfast sandwiches that I never received. 20 mins in I asked the status of my order and was told I was next in line. Watched 4 people get their order before me; even though they ordered after me. I eventually got tired of waiting & seeing other get their order before me; I asked for a refund. I understand this place is short staffed, but seeing people get their order before me was the cherry on top. I wouldn't recommend this place.

This place is a joke. The food is really good which is why we tried it again. The time that it takes to get the food is ridiculous. We waited 27 minutes from the time we ordered until the time we received the food. For 2 sandwiches. No special order, no changes, just 2 sandwiches. The dining area is more of a waiting room. Take a look at the number of people with a drink but no food. Sunflour slow before Covid, really slow during Covid (understandably) but service has gotten slower. We've tried for years to like this place. The food is good. The service is poor.
Great food! The rosemary bread is great with anything!

Ordered my coffee at 10:58, a simple medium drip coffee, and did not have it until 11:11. There were plenty of people who got their coffees after i had ordered.  I understand a rush, but to pour a drip coffee should take less than 30 seconds.
Just confused. Ordered a Turkey BLT and  I got an email saying it would take aN hour to make. Then when I got it it only had Turkey avocado and the bread. Missing the 3 main things lol. Do better.

The #6 sandwich - egg sausage and tomato pesto was really good (I removed the arugula). Lots of flavor and the cheddar biscuit was really yummy, but a lot of bread. One star less because it took a while to prepare.
I love that this bakery has lots of gf and vegan treats available. So yummy.

Best breakfast burrito in town!  These types of healthy/trendy menus are usually a turn off for me. The wife loves the place, which usually means I won't.  However, to appease her we went here and I was very happy with the breakfast burrito. It's been the best I've had outside of the burritos in Arizona. Enjoyed it so much I forgot to take a picture...  The pastries are worlds better than the much overrated Amelies.

I've given this place a try. A few tries and they are consistently slow. Ordered avocado toast at 7:40 at 8 o'clock it still was not ready. There were literally three people in there that already had their food and was eating so I'm confused as to what was taking so long. Like really how long does it take to make avocado toast with turkey. Only to receive it and there's no turkey. What is the purpose of ordering a head if it's not going to be ready ? It was $8you mean to tell me for a eight dollar piece of avocado toast with turkey and It can't be ready?? I wish they would put something else there. Another breakfast spot.

The location on Elizabeth on 7th Street in Charlotte North Carolina is the initial location that I fell in love with and discovered. After many years of turmoil the incorrect front end employees the service has returned to a level that makes it the place that I no longer romanticize but have come to expect as a place to ascertain and achieve excellent artistry food with Superior products and a fantastic vegan selection.
Best bacon egg and cheese croissant!
Great staff, great atmosphere and great coupons!

If you want an overpriced breakfast sandwich made of rubber fake eggs that look like tofu that takes 25 Mins to come out, this is the place for you. Save yourself the time and $ and get better quality at McDonald's..... Cashier lady was nice (blonde girl)
Very average place as far as the desserts go. The staff made it somewhat worse.
Best morning glory muffin

Thank you for the best customer service and for making the chai latte right!!  It's been so long since someone made it right and you guys were on point - made my day. Will totally be back, have a good one~!
We were in town for a bachelorette party & we stopped here for coffee & breakfast sandwiches & WOW. The chicken caprese panini was next level. Friendly staff. Will suggest to anyone in the area.
Great Rosemary Olive Oil Bread, fast service.
Cheddar biscuits are irresistible!

Extremely disappointed in the quality of our food. After a 25 minute wait we received two sorry looking sandwiches not even cut in half. Could've made better at home in not even half the time. The lemonade was good

I have been coming here to the East location  since Day One and the front end staff continue to decline. We don't want to walk in and not get a hello nor a good morning, be happy. Instead we get a sour attitude as if we were bothering them by coming in. I asked for regular white sugar and was told they didn't have any. What, you are a bakery, do I look stupid or is it your laziness, grabbing a ramekin and get a little scoop from the back isntoo much work? In the past, that is what others have done, but nope not this crew. Sad to see this place go down the list of places to stop in and get my weekly items.

The sandwich was soooooo delicious.  They were also very apologetic about giving me the wrong cookie that I paid $3 for. They said that they would refund me for the cookie, but I haven't seen it yet. That's cool though. The sandwich made up for it and their excellent customer service

I would've left a 3 star but the workers are rude. Customer service is as a 4/10 at its best. They look at you with disgust as if they don't want to be at work.  Cinnamon rolls weren't all that. Coffee was decent. Croissants had too much butter.  Definitely won't be coming back.
Kinda high

I really debated coming here after two bad experiences by a bunch of girls who were young and White and I am not racist but this was the case. Today I was gonna go to Amelia's but wanted to stop quickly before getting my kid and thought let me try this place again and what a surprise had done customer service from two beautiful queens she gave me hot coffee and I told her cold had no issue remaking it and had such upbeat attitudes needles to say I will be back but if they ain't there back out the door I go lmbo….  Thanks ladies 😊
Always a solid choice for a quick breakfast bite

Food is good,  service is great... but why do they stop serving breakfast at 11am?  I will not be able to get there before noon on weekends,  so I guess that means we are not coming back for breakfast :(
The coffee is really good. The staff are incredibly friendly and happy and upbeat. Local shop that definitely is a gem. I can't speak on the food but the pastries looked delicious.
This place is great. Can't go wrong between their sandwiches, cookies, and coffee. Their latte might be the best in Charlotte. The overall vibe of the place could be better though.
Layne (sorry if i butchered the spelling) was amazing and recommenced the avocado melt which was amazing! cute pastries too!

Way Way Way too expensive! Got an egg and cheese (only) sandwich on a croissant for $9!!! And the egg was a rectangle egg paty, not even a real egg! Croissant was pretty good but not worth the crazy prices. Carrot cake in a jar was just okay.
total Chaos, likely Cold. Unless they aren't busy, then it's on point.

I entered this business today at 3:51pm to order a sandwich, the cashier asks what I want to order and I say a sandwich, she tells me let me see if sandwiches are open. She talks with someone in the back then comes back and tell me sandwiches are closed, I'm sorry we close in 5 mins. Terrible customer service and I am not sure if it's because I am an African American or what but what business in the business of selling sandwiches and are open closes just that product when your business hours say you close at 4:00pm and your doors are still open? Someone please explain this to me?  Dr. S. Stanley 4:03pm outside of the business in my car!
The food was great and the staff was awesome.
Great breakfast sandwiches, cheddar biscuits, and sweets. Always friendly as well. Great place
Good customer service is EVERYTHING...will not be supporting this business again.
Love this place great food and coffee. Very busy spot. Go early and enjoy the food sbd staff. Very friendly staff and manager.
This little place is Amazing and Quick 😜
Love the gluten free treats. Gotta go early in the week to get them.
Terribly run place, cakes still raw, roaches in kitchen. Under staffed
Visited while in town visiting family and friends. The cheddar biscuits and maple oat scones are amazing. Cinnamon rolls are great but hard to come by because they sell out.
This is the original spot and completely amazing foods.
Best ever  haven't  tasted  breakfast  this good  anywhere in Charlotte  you gotta  give  them a try

Serving bad avocados is not okay. I own a food business myself and I understand the difficulties with avocados, but this is the second time this happens.  I've probably ordered the same sandwich about 6 times. 2 out of the 6 this has happened,hence the not bad rating, but one time it happened with friends I had hyped up about your business.  I can't share your business with other people because the quality is not consistent. Something in your operations needs a closer look.  All that being said, I really hope it gets better since I love your #3 on cheddar biscuit.
The white girl at the front needs to do a better job at acknowledging incoming customers. I literally stood there for 2 mins, with her not providing any assistance
I'm sorry but my experience at this sunflour wasn't pleasant 😕 I waited 35 minutes for a egg sandwich, the young man at the counter did offer me a muffin. I like the one on Mallard better 😌 sorry
THIS PLACE HAS THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. It's so bad it's comedic. They never get the order right. They're incredibly slow. And rude. Go Some place else.
1st. time in bakery, and not as impressed as I thought I would be. Small selection of goodies.

This place can get really busy, especially in the morning, but for good reason. They have a great breakfast sandwiches, especially if you get the cheddar biscuit! Can't recommend it enough, it is humongous, filling and full of flavor.
Great cinnamon rolls and cheddar biscuits!

I'm a doordasher, so I'm talking to my fellow dashers. If you ever come to this restaurant just know you will be treated rudely. This is my second time coming to this restaurant and have been disappointed and disrespected. When things go wrong on DoorDash end the employees just expect for you to know everything and not ask questions. She literally told me she called and canceled, I don't have nothing to give you and throw her hands up. I will never take another delivery from this location. The tone and attitude was not calls for. If you knew the customer couldn't get in contact with DoorDash. The restaurant it self should have contacted DoorDash to keep down the confusion and disrespect.
Friendly staff, great coffee, and their sandwiches are always out of this world. I tried the GF mini cake donut today - highly recommend!!

Very nice aesthetically pleasing cafe. They serve more than just fresh brewed coffee, but wonderfully baked bread and baked goods. The workers were very nice and professional. I simply cannot understand the negative reviews, but I suppose some people are just looking to complain. All in all, I look forward to returning to eat here.
Ordered DD and they left off a whole order, when I called the store Courtney went above and beyond to make sure we got our order delivered, and was super sweet and helpful. The food is phenomenal!

The #6 breakfast sandwich on a cheddar biscuit was OUT OF THIS WORLD delicious! Everyone seemed really nice. My mom also loved her croissant and blueberry muffin, which she said were some of the best she's ever had.  Only four stars because the coffees weren't that good. But still worth a visit for the food alone!

I gave it 2 chances but I'll never go back. The staff is cold and unwelcoming. No one smiles. Both times, it took forever for someone to take my order. Each time, I was on the verge of walking out. I get the impression the staff does not like working there. The breakfast sandwiches are over priced for what they are. Sliced over toasted bread. No seasoning on the eggs which aren't even fresh cracked. Tastes like McDonald's folded egg. I needed ketchup, hot sauce, AND bbq sauce to eat it. I'm from NYC where a baconeggandcheese (yes, one word) is considered to be the breakfast of champions. I could never stop here before going to the office!

Coffee drinks are hit or miss. Sandwich's and pastries are generally good (that is if they don't forget to give it to you) but the slow service just isn't worth going there anymore. They were slow before the worker shortage so that's not the problem. 40 mins for a pickup order is ridiculous.
Great 👍 Food & Service Highly Recommended
Tasty breakfast sandwiches.
I puchased 2 chocolate/chocolate cookies. To my surprise, there is salt on top of one cookie. I'm not an extra salt eater. Very disappointed.

I was just in sunflower and the lady was very short with us and was not the nicest lady, she seemed like she didn't want to be there and my friend went in 1 minute after they closed to get some water because she was really dehydrated and the lady snapped at her and said we're closed in a very snappy way and we sat outside since they were closed and she came outside 2 mins later and said I'm going to need that table in a mean tone. I've always loved sunflower and I go there all the time and they are always so nice and kind there so I don't know why she was so snappy with us.

Good food and coffee, but the absolute slowest service! I want to come here, to a local business, so much more than the Starbucks down the street, but they make it very difficult especially when I just want to grab a quick coffee on my way to work. The most frustrating part is they'll have multiple people behind the counter, but only one person doing coffee and that's what everyone is waiting on.

Great food and baked goods. Unfriendly attitude from behind the counter. Please, thank you, and you're welcome go along way in a service industry position. Especially since masks hide facial expressions.
The food is good but like other reviews have mentioned, it takes forever to get your order whether you order in the store or ahead online for pick-up.
The vanilla cheesecake was yummy! 😃

We've always loved coming to Sunflour - they have the best BLT on their cheddar biscuits. Because of the slow service however, we hadn't been in quite some time. We decided to try it again this past weekend and placed an online order for 4 sandwiches. After the order was confirmed, it said it would be ready at 10:15. We arrived a few minutes late at 10:20, expecting it to be ready but it was not. I stood by the prepaid order pick up without being acknowledged for over 5 minutes while workers were just pidding around. After finally getting the attention of someone, I was told our order was not ready and it would be up next. Fast forward 15 more minutes and it was still not ready. In total, our 10:15 order wasn't ready until 10:50 which is beyond acceptable. To make things worse we got home and they were prepared incorrectly. Sadly, we will likely not be visiting this location again due to the poor service.
Great service. Excellent pastries and croissants. Best in all of Charlotte.

The food is great but the service is just terrible and it takes forever. I had written this place off for this reason for the last 6 months. I gave it one last shot today. Took me 20 minutes to get an iced tea that takes 5 minutes to steep. When I went in for the second time to see what was going on I was told they were out of ice so they were trying to cool it down in the freezer. bizarre.
Would not recommend this bakery. Food is served cold, staff is unfriendly and you definitely do not get what you are paying for.
Good pastry Good cappuccino Friendly staff.

The panini sandwiches were amazing! We had avocado melt , but without avocado, we substituted tuna. We are definitely looking forward to trying the pastries next time! The staff , especially the manager, was professional and very attentive to our needs, even at the end of their busy day. We appreciate you!
Great place to grab a cappuccino and a  Croissant. Service was fast and professional. Give it a try.

I like coming for the pastries but they are very disorganized and are never open at time. When you say you open at 7:00, I should be able to walk in at 7:00. Not seeing you guys get yourselves together with the doors locked. Very disrespectful of customers' time
Their croissant is out of this world!
Great spot for a quick bakery bite and Pure intentions coffee!
Their breakfast sandwiches are always so good. Love their coffee as well.

Yesterday was the first time my husband and I went to this bakery. I purchased the  Carrot Oat Muffin, I loved it. My husband purchased 2 Croissants, and 2 round crunchy rolls to take home. He definitely liked the Croissants and rolls and would definitely buy they again.
Great experience
(Translated by Google) Delicious...  (Original) Delicioso...
Always delicious

I don't normally leave reviews. But I had to. This is my first time ordering from Sunflour- I ordered the grilled cheese with tomato cheddar and provolone. And added avocado and egg. The egg is microwaved egg - which for a company, microwaving eggs is the Dunkin' Donuts way of serving quick and disgusting breakfast. There was no tomato in my sandwich and the cheddar cheese was barely melted. I rated a 2 because minus the eggs - which I had to remove and paid an extra $1 for- the sandwich still tasted ok. Just not up to par with what I expected and definitely not worth the price I paid.

Honestly, get anything from here. You will not be disappointed. I love to come for breakfast, to grab a loaf of homemade rosemary sourdough sliced bread, & any treat. Today, I got the sweet potato meringue. Heaven.
Look, the food is good. But I had a pre-arranged pickup time and still had to wait 40 minutes. Very, very dissatisfied.

Y'all....the pastries at Sunflour Baking Company are amazing!!! My favorite is the cinnamon role. They are huge and the frosting is delicious!!!  Update: I have removed a star because there are never any pastries ready at 7am when they open, despite customers already lining up at the door. I so often leave empty handed or with a day old stale pastry from the back because they aren't prepared at opening.
Good pastries

Nice menu. A little pricey but all is fresh and good! Had some bakery items (several over a few days) and all were great. My date had the tuna sandwich and I had the grilled cheese with tomato. It was all very good. We will be back.
Of course the bread the best think you could get from here! Everything taste fresh and light!

Love this place. Always great customer service. Besides their amazing treats in the displays I have ordered a few vegan cakes and they were soooooo delicious! Consistently perfect every time. Thank you for making my families birthdays extra special!
The food is always soooo good!
Very nice and comfy place for coffee and bakery. I ordered few sandwiches  and apple turnover. OMG!! Tasty!!!

I normally like Sunflour, but this past order really turned me off. #1 left out dessert. #2 BLT was old: extremely soggy tomato, old bacon. I had to spit it out and couldn't finish it because the old soggy tomato had soaked into the rest of the sandwich. The BLTs are usually excellent, but this has turned my stomach. surely the person that created it knew they were using a soggy old tomato. Update 2 mins later: Coffee DEFINITELY old too. Can't drink it
ONCE U GO HERE..YOU WILL ALWAYS COME BACK!! FRIENDLY GREAT SERVICE!! MY CHILDREN ARE HOOKED!! BEST BAKERY!!

I've eaten here for years and it's always good. I love the avocado melt (avocado, spinach, pesto, tomato, and goat cheese) and the banana chocolate chip muffin is perfect! Their bread is also really good; I love the sourdough. They carry coffee from Pure Intentions, a Charlotte based roaster, and sell bags of it for you to make at home! They also have cake jars that you can ship to friends and family across the US.
Fantastic bakery tastiest.

Most importantly, I received excellent service. Ordered a blueberry filled croissant, FANTASTIC! Over several visits, the quality of their baked goods has been consistent and of high standard. Simply put, great baked items and great service. They also have a good variety of teas and coffee.
Cute place. Not very friendly but efficient. Good cookies. Very clean.
Great food plenty of healthy choices
The breads for the breakfast sandwiches are amazing! The rest of the sandwich is okay but the bread elevates it to another level.
Fantastic

I have been to this location several times and the food and service has always been great. But our visit on 8/22/20 at around 12:30 pm the woman who was presumably the manager on duty was extremely rude. I waited over 30 minutes for an iced mocha, people who had come in after me were getting their food before I even got my drink. My sister got her drink within 2 minutes of ordering but mine never came. When I attempted to explain this to her several times (at least 3) she kept cutting me off and asking me if I had gotten my “latte” which I had never ordered. But instead of waiting 5 second for me to finish my sentence she was brash, and cut me off several times like I didn't know what I was talking about. She also treated several other customers this way. Everyone else there was very kind and the girl working the drink station apologized profusely even though it wasn't her fault. But the managers attitude was very off putting and not representative of what I have come to know sunflour bakery to be. If I was rating just off her attitude it would be one star. I only added an additional one due to the kindness of the other staff members.

This place was so-so. The coffee was cold and it was the last cup they were making so they didn't replace it, however they did offer us free pastries after the fact to compensate, which was nice of them.
The food was unique and very tasty. I tried the avocado Panini, with goat cheese and roasted tomatoes.
I loved their breakfast sandwich on their croissant!
The breakfast sandwiches and cinnamon rolls are fantastic!
Phenomenal place to eat breakfast! I had an egg, bacon, and cheddar sandwich on an English muffin and loved it!
Baked goods and sandwiches here are top notch 👌.  Egg Avocado Cheese, chocolate chip banana muffins!

The food here is great, a nice selection of paninis, baked goods and desserts, priced fairly! coffee is great, $1.75 for a small drip and its very smooth and the beans are roasted just right.  interior is always clean and service is great.

This was my first time ordering a breakfast sandwich here and I ordered it for pickup. The egg was fake egg in a square on barely toasted, non buttered bread. Had the topping listed on it, cheese, cold tomato, cold spinach, and provolone. For the price, I will not be ordering a breakfast sandwich from there again.  The order online and pick up process needs to be improved, I waited in line with no direction or update from who was working. Myself and others were very confused what we were supposed to be doing if we ordered online. I saw my food sitting on the back counter and had to get someone's attention and let them know I was there to pick up an online order.
they do not prepare the order quickly
Always delicious. Upscale bakery, gluten free and vegan options. Never disappointed.

Inefficient counter because you order and pay at register.  If you order over phone and don't pay,  fully expect to have to wait in line 15-20mins to just get to counter.  Unless you pay over phone you wait in same line.  Disappointed as food And pastries are generally good.
food was great! but, the Danish was thrown upside down in the bag. all filling was in the bottom of the bag. Muffins just thrown in upside down as well. Should have done better.
This was a nice little find while we were looking for somewhere to get breakfast. Nice breakfast sandwiches and pastries. They're put together fresh so allow yourself a little time.
Excellent customer service!
Best if you want eggless cake in charlotte.. but you need to order before 3-4 days..
The berry croissant was amazing!
Got 3 desserts and a coffee and the girl at the cash register was very sweet. Thanks for being nice. Clean rr and dining area. Will revist.

Sunflour in Elizabeth is such a kind and inviting environment, and they have great treats too! The staff are always friendly, and I once witnessed them give a meal to a man in need, while treating him with such kindness and dignity. Shout out also to the new guy with glasses, such great attention to detail!  The cinnamon rolls and chocolate croissants are the best I have ever had!  ALSO, great gluten free vegan options!
Love their cheddar biscuits with avocado. Cozy seating environment with relaxing music.
Delicous!
Best croissants in the United States. Some foodie magazine needs to catch wind of this superbly unassuming bakery.

I have been going to Sunflour bakery since it opened, and I live in the Elisabeth neighborhood. I will not be going to this establishment anymore. The employees often get my order wrong, and have a general bad attitude. They NEVER have cinnamon rolls when I come in to order, which is usually late morning. For how expensive their prices are, I expected a bit more.
Great breakfast sandwiches, love their sourdough but the other breads are nice as well. Definitely worth stopping in for breakfast when I'm in the area.
Great coffee and pastries! Breakfast sandwiches are awesome and the poptart is phenomenal! So good worth the wait!
Notting at this store.
Fantastic Chedder biscuit breakfast sandwiches...and to die for French press coffee!! A regular stop.
This place is good but busy on the weekends  get there  early
Really tasty and great staff
The croissant was okay but the coffee was really bad.
Omg so freaking good! Had an egg and cheese on a cheddar biscuit the size of my head! It was so crispy on the outside and perfect. Cant wait to try everything on the menu :p

BEST gluten-free muffins ever! My mom is a life-long baker who unfortunately has to now eat gluten-free. She has tried baking muffins but nothing compares to Sunflour's! I LOVE the cheddar biscuits, vegan banana chocolate chip muffins and chocolate chip scones. Mom is getting a gluten-free cake this week for her birthday: there are so many choices it will be difficult to decide! Our only complaint: items are so popular (esp the GF items), they are frequently sold-out.
Underwhelmed by the limit of gluten free items. Nice little cafe but left me wanting more.
Great as always. No keylime pie today though
Good food. Needs more seating.

I want to love this place. So many options and the pastries are delicious. I always end up waiting forever for my latte, and usually somehow it gets messed up. Wrong milk, flavor, size. It's always something with the coffee or food. Pastries are great and some amazing vegan options. I have ordered a cake through them once, and it was perfect.

One of my favorite breakfast spots, I prefer the East Blvd location because their cheddar biscuits are always more fresh and fluffy. One of my favorite sandwiches in Charlottes is their Bacon, egg, cheese, with avacado.

A great bakery and coffee place that seems to be on the hip side.  This is a cozy place where you can get some studying or computer work done as well.  The staff here is great also.  I will say that the parking situation in this area could improve.  Maybe they could build and underground parking area or something....

waited 25 minutes after placing an order for a sandwich only to realize that they never put in the order. but not only was i waiting, there were at least 5 other people waiting who's food had not even been started on. i walked around the side to see the cook on his phone
Average. A tad pretentious.
They have breakfast sandwiches, and very cool vibe. I liked my experience here.
Great pastries and coffee concoctions.
Loved the avocado melt grilled panini and fresh lemonade.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions and tailoring our food to us.
A fine bakery!
Real tasty treats and coffee.
Our sandwiches were excellent.  I highly recommend the Rosemary bread.
Great sandwiches, pastries, and coffee.
Very very very good croissants
Great coffee and muffins
Yummy sourdough bread!
Great meeting place 👍. Spacious, super fresh food and helpful staff.
Highly recommend any of the breakfast sandwiches on the cheddar biscuit. The giant iced cinnamon rolls are phenomenal (perfect gooey center) and pair nicely with a dirty mocha! We will be back.
Been coming here since the beginning and always enjoyed the experience and the food. But today it was untidy, dirty and in disarray. Looks like they're going out of business.
I mean, look at this Cinnamon Roll!!
Cinnamon roll tasted weird and stale
Way overpriced, service was rude.
Great breads, staff could use some work following the instructions left for them, but always nice!
#4 on a cheddar biscuit is my favorite
Delicious quick bites, healthy and fresh!
Great friendly service. We had the almond Joy cheesecake and the buckeye brownie. Both were amazing. Can't wait to go back and try more from their menu.
Great service
Amazing baked goods, tremendous cheddar biscuits. Can't wait to go back and try some lunch sandwiches. Cinnamon rolls are huge, croissants as well. Something for everyone!

Had breakfast sandwiches which sounded good, looked good, but the sheet pan eggs cut square were col and the cheese was half melted, but cold. The bread was only warm because it had come out of panini press.
Great coffee and sandwiches! I always get a mocha and a turkey avocado bacon (TAB) sandwich on rosemary bread. Yum!
Pleasant restaurant with a unique menu.  Excellent staff and the food was good.  Good restaurant to give a try. Parking is limited.

Very hard to get in and out of parking lot.  In fact it is dangerous.  Staff cannot answer questions about products.  Young high school staff only trained to ring up and not answer customer questions.

The Service sucks in this place. I think the girl with red hair was having a bad day or something? I had the carrot muffin it was just ok and my latte a bit weak. Will not come back to this place or recommend anyone.
I love Sunflower! Their muffins are so perfect, I love Blueberry or Lemon Poppyseed, I love their breakfast sandwiches, and I always get a Tumeric-Ginger Chai 😄
Great pastries
Delis
chocolate croissants
Great goods!!! Love their 7 grains bread.

Their muffins are great and bettter when heated. I had one with choc chips that melted in my mouth. Sandwich was good too. I like decaffeinated coffee and they were low when I got there, so while they made me a fresh pot I looked at the Wonderful art on the rail on the wall. The artist are good, management varies the type monthly and the prices are reasonable. BTW the coffee was very good too. Food, drink and art.

I have taste tested about 7 different cupcake bakers around this city in the last week looking for the right cupcake. Sunflour Baking is my new favorite. I usually try a red velvet and a vanilla type cupcake to test. They were fantastic with the texture, moisture and flavor of both the icing and the cake. Great baking!
Made me a keto egg dish it was great.
Uh, the cheese biscuits... The Only!
best bakery coffee spot in charlotte. muffins are the GOAT
Delicious food and fresh baked goods.

Good food small portions. Worst customer service ever. I stood waiting for 5 minutes trying to order while the cashier played on her phone and talked the Baker. When I finally got her attention she was very rude.
Almond croissant 😍😍😍😍

Their egg is delicious, loved the peach tea but the muffin smelled like bacon when I first got it out of the bag it was weird since I don't eat meat. Only giving 5 stars because the egg on my croissant was delicious
Fabulous sourdough bread! Great breakfast muffins and double chocolate cupcakes! Yum!
Good coffee, simple whole foods menu.
I wouldn't recommend for lunch as the sandwich's were a little bland. But the desserts are delicious! I had a tiramisu and it was one of the best I've tried!
Great pastries and grilled sandwiches
Great food but the price reflects it. Anything on the chedar biscuit is amazing.
Awesome spot for coffee and paninis. My favorite is the Avocado melt but haven't come across something I haven't liked here yet. I highly recommend!
Great. It's a bit pricey but SO amazingly good!

This was my first and probably last visit,  first reason the staff is extremely rude. I was waiting to order and no one acknowledged me, there was no one in line. Some guy comes  in after me and walks up they immediately acknowledge him. I was there at 9am to try the cinnamon rolls when she finally acknowledges me she says we don't have any. So I go with the Apple Pumpkin muffin to go. It was very stale did not taste fresh.
Best cupcakes!! Everything is delicious from the sandwiches to the baked goods!

This is a review based on several visits. I have had the cupcakes in the past and they were very good but the CINNAMON ROLL is the best I've ever had. They usually sell out early so I would suggest going prior to 2pm to get one. I go just for the roll. If they are out of them, I leave. I gave 4 stars because the service here can be hit or miss. The staff for the most part is nice but I have gotten my cinnamon roll heated and they seem to have issues with something so simple. One time they burned it a  little and it was the last one. The young lady didn't say anything  when she served it to me and when I mentioned it she said “Oh yeah, I saw that. They left it in the oven too long.” She said she would replace it with something else if it was inedible however I guess it was the end of her shift because she left before I had a chance to talk to her again. Most recently, it wasn't warm enough but I didn't want to risk getting another burnt one so I just ate it anyway. More ttention to detail would garner a 5 star from me.
Biscuits and Croissants are always fresh and flaky. Service is always with a smile. Awesome and delicious.
Love this bakery! Everyone is very friendly and the food was delicious!
Expensive for food quality and portion size. Wait to receive food was over 20 minutes, and then incorrect.
My favorite breakfast place in Charlotte
Went in to meet with a client. Very friendly staff very easy-going nice menu for breakfast and lunch. Would recommend it
Excellent sandwich...what really put it over the top was the fantastic fresh sliced sourdough...
Slow merchant smh

So this is a mixed review because we've had great visits and not so great visits. I love their cinnamon rolls but warmed up; however, 50% of the time that seems to be a tough order to fill. However simple it may seem but we've had other items not properly made. A simple cup of regular black coffee took over 5 minutes to get to me. For some reason the simple is the most complicated. We love the atmosphere and the food is good but the attention to detail when I order seems to be forgotten half the time.
Mediocre sandwich, no love, slow service
It was just ok long wait for a tuna melt hardly any tuna staff was ok but food was way average

These cupcakes are to die for. I mean really, these are the best cupcakes. Knocking off one star because I went once for breakfast, and was disappointed. My sandwich was pricey and nothing special.  Maybe I had too high expectations based off my love of the cupcakes.

This is just around the corner from my house, and it's quickly become one of my favorite spots to either meet a friend or read a book on my own. I love the breakfast sandwich on a croissant so much that it's difficult for me to try anything else.  They have a whole case of baked goods, though I rarely indulge. Everything in that case looks delectable! I'm going tomorrow for breakfast!

I believe their previous employees left because I have seen new faces and also noticed it in the service they now have. This place used to be my favorite but lately whenever I go there it is a 15-20 min wait for a latte when there are only 4 people in line and two employees at the counter. It should not take this long. Maybe they lack training which is something management should be taking care of.  For example today one employee took my order  then took the order of the girl behind me and made her iced coffee first before she started to make my latte even though I had been there first and ordered first, the other girl behind me received her items and left before I did. Then she started to make my latte but stopped in the middle to bag another customers muffins and later continue to make my latte. I believe three people came and left while I stood there waiting and then when I get to work it is not even made correctly.

Great food, atmosphere, and friendly staff. It reminds me of some cafes in France. However, if you are planning on bringing in your laptop to do some work like many do, be prepared to fire up a hotspot to connect to. The WiFi at Sunflour is atrocious and has been as long as I have been a customer (a year or so). I really like this place, but I expect any cafe these days to have a good WiFi connection. My rating would be 5 stars without considering the wifi troubles.
Great baked goods
Oh my beautiful baby Jesus! This cheddar biscuit alone. And the cinnamon rolls
Great coffee friendly staff. Def check it out
Delicious breakfast sandwiches and pastries
They say the have gluten free cupcakes but it's not all the time.
LOVE this local spot.  Clean, friendly, consistently delicious. Try the cinnamon rolls the size of your face. They are divine!

I don't even live near a sunflour but will wake up early for a BEC cheddar biscuit or matcha latte. It's really that good, trust me. Thank the heavens for their rewards program. And the people are so nice, I know I wake up on the wrong side of the bed and their still so nice. Although its not the "best" decision for breakfast, so, it's delicious and fresh.
Soup and danish was great
The food is delicious! I had eggs, bacon, cheese, and avocado on a cheddar bisuit. The people who work there are very friendly and welcoming also.
Mmmmmm great food.
Good but cost too much 😢
way, way overpriced
Best croissants in Charlotte. Hands down.
Decent food, but overpriced. Tables weren't very clean. Water was room temperature. :(

This truly feels like a neighborhood bakery... intimate, no overblown menu, and cozy.  I have seen  kids having breakfast still in their PJs beside at a table beside someone in a suit.  The menu items are tasty and obviously made in-house.  They participate in Fivestars Loyalty program, which gave me the opportunity to try one of their butter bread rolls for free - which was amazing.
Blueberry GF Sconce was delicious! Loved the unattended childrens signage...

Not the cheapest place around but you definitely get what you pay for. If the line isn't too long and you have the time to wait, the egg, ham, cheddar croissant is amazing. Chocolate cupcake is awesome as well.

This Cafe is cute inside, the sunflowers make it bright, the pastries are delicious. But one thing that I really disliked is that it's very dirty, all the tables are dirty, the floor needs a good sweep, and just some little things that need a bit wiping. If it was clean, it would have been a lot more inviting.
Best and biggest cinnamon rolls in town. I also love their breakfast sandwiches on croissants. The amount of meat on them have declined, but still good.

Absolutely the best!!!! I thoroughly enjoyed my Spicy Hummus Veggie Grilled Panini. I also had the Zucchini brownie...the frosting was amazing. My family ordered the Cheddar biscuit and a Croissant with bacon egg and cheese, blueberry muffin and Cinnamon roll....ALL delicious  and wonderfully made!!! This will definitely be a must stop anytime we are in the Charlotte area. Thank you to the Sunflour baking staff for a job well done.
Excellent small bakery and coffee shop with standout macaroons.

I love everything about Sunflour. They have coffee in an ice cream cone, because why not? And their pastries are delicious. I love their croissants - so flakey - and they brew pure intentions coffee so of course it's good. They also have a loyalty program where you give your phone number and rack up points that lead to free cups of coffee and such.
Great place for a delicious quick breakfast!

Cute little place. Desserts were great. Bread was tasty. Everything is from scratch so they say and its believable as far as I can tell. Staff was super friendly and helpful with any questions. The peach blossom tea was very good and its loose leaf. The only thing that didnt make it 5 stars was a small menu. No complaints elsewhere.
Good customer service and very well made desserts
Exactly What I Expect from a Bakery.
Amazing baked goods. A great place for coffee and a catch up with friends, or for a quick business meeting. The food is always good and they have a rewards system in place. There is also free wifi.
Unique selection of bakery items and great coffee!

We love this place!!  We are only going to be in Charlotte for a week, but we've already gone here twice and plan to stop in again before heading out.  Their breakfast sandwiches are delicious, and they'll serve them all day - which we love since we're still on West Coast time.  The service is always friendly and quick.  Thanks for being so great!!  Finding good coffee and breakfast can be one of the harder parts of traveling, so we were glad to find you on our first try!!
Best scones in town, favorite coffee. Excellent vegan options and my hands down favorite deli tuna salad. I tried it on rosemary bread and now cant have it any other way!!
The cinnamon roll was amazing!
Small, great sandwiches, and bakery,
Nice bakery that's a popular hangout for the locals
Wonderfully delicious
Great Coffee and Avocado Sandwich!
They serve breakfast all day.
Baked goods are good, but the sandwiches are small and not that great--expensively

Great breakfast sandwiches and pastries. They have new pastries all the time, try the Earle Gray cookie when they have it. It can get crowded at regular meal times and weekends, we try to go during off hours.
Great coffee and amazing croissants!
😋 i go for the cinnamon rolls

Everything at this Bakery is truly delicious! They offer a wide variety of pastries such as croissants, eclairs, muffins, pies, and they even have cupcakes. They also offer breakfast sandwiches, lunch sandwiches and soups, and coffee bar drinks. While every food item I have had here has been spectacular, the black coffee is the only thing I can approve of from the coffee bar. The lattes do not have enough flavor. There are much better places to go if you are looking for a latte. They have bar stools facing the window so you can look outside, and café tables throughout the interior. They also have an outdoor seating area, but it is very tiny, consisting of only three or four tables with two seats each. This establishment is friendly to those who would like to come and work on their laptops. Parking is difficult because there are multiple stores sharing a small parking lot. Many of the spaces are a tight fit if you have a mid to large-size car. Even with all of those factors in consideration, this is by far my favorite Bakery in Charlotte. Amelie's is absolutely overrated. If you like Amelie's, come here and try what pastries are supposed to taste like.
Fast and friendly. A great place to pick up a fresh quick bite on the go! Great sandwiches soups and cupcakes!
Great stuff! Need a better ordering setup, little scattered and unorganized. Great sandwiches and coffee!
Biggest cinnamon rolls in the land
Great place for coffee, scones and bread
One of the best kept secrets in Charlotte's! Way better than Amilie's they have several gluten free options that are to die for and their regular desserts are fabulous too
Amazing sweet and sauvory treats. Still dream about their cinnamon roll, cheddar biscuit sandwiches and the hazelnut orange roll.
Save your money, go somewhere else.

Awesome hand made pastries and biscuits. Get the sausage and cheddar biscuit! A bit pricey but quality is worth it. Ask them to heat up your products before hand because they won't do it after you receive your items!
Don't expect the hand crafted sandwiches to come out super fast, but they are delicious. I love the TAB and I add cheddar.
Only wish we had several in Chattanooga. Real coffee, real pastries and real ambiance.
Everything in this place is delicious. It's my place to get a treat for myself. Also the Carmel cupcakes are amazing!!!

My boyfriend shops at Heroes every week and I noticed the sign. Sunflowers are my favorite flower so the name alone immediatelt caught my attention. Last week I went to this area with him and we visited this bakery.  IT WAS SO GOOD. I had the brie, apple slices, arugula and fig jam panini - I cannot even believe how delicious this was. There are so many vegetarian and vegan (the vegan chocolate and banana muffin was incredible) options also. I will definitely be coming back!
Good breakfast sandwiches and average coffee. A little bit pricy but that could just be the market for that area.
It s very delicious

This place is awesome. Walked half mile from our stay place to visit and definitely definitely worth it. Cheddar biscuit was wonderful. Like heaven  had egg, cheddar, and avacado  cheddar biscuit. It was perfect!!! Getting ready to top it off with a huge cinnamon roll with my friend. Hope we can eat it all. And best of all their dirty mocha was breathtaking and heavenly.  Definitely come here for this experience! !!! u will not regret it.
try the cinnamon roll. You will be glad you did. Great coffee, too!!!
Great place. The food is fresh and the ambience is clean and cheerful. Love it!
Wonderful!
Cinnamon rolls are 🤗

This place is amazing, from food to drinks to pastries!  I live nearby (never been to another location) and visit this place very frequently.  Would have 5 stars if services wasn't painfully slow.  I don't mind waiting but if you are in a hurry or an impatient person, keep that in mind, otherwise totally worth the wait!!
Good sandwiches & coffee. Gets pretty loud inside when they're full.
Kind of pricey, but great dishes
Commented to my wife while we were here that all things considered this is our favorite overall coffee shop in town. The food is excellent.

Love their cheddar biscuits with bacon, egg, and cheese, and add some tomato and avocado.  Their cinnabunns are great as well.  Love the atmosphere, parking is terrible at this location. Service is always great@
The best vegan pastry,
Efficient & pleasant service.  Smells.like a bakery should.  Great breads, pastries and breakfast, lunch & dinner selections.  Small selection of beer & wine.  Quiet and chill background music.
The vegan chocolate chip cookie was delicious! Pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff.
Best cinnamon rolls in the world and croissants
Delicious food, nice atmosphere.  The tuna melt is my favorite! The portions are a bit small for the price you pay, but by going here you are supporting a local small business.

The people that work there are really nice. Unfortunately, the place is just not worth any of my money. They don't cater to any sort of needs to people with allergies. Their seating arrangement is clustered. I was charged over four dollars for an iced green tea that was excruciatingly watered down.  Lastly, the parking is heinous.
(Translated by Google) Very tasty pastries. I recommend trying TAB on a croissant. And kakkeki :)  (Original) Очень вкусная выпечка. Рекомендую попробовать TAB на круассане. И какпкеки :)

Good coffee, uplifting atmosphere. Great baked goods -- they are huge and they make them  themselves.  Seating is a little "sterile" (good thing they have cushions);  they could use a redesign for comfort and a little more privacy. Overall, friendly place!
Great bread, and muffins, coffee
Service was questionable. ..food always delicious
Great food.  Can be a bit crowded and noisy on weekends, but definitely worth a visit.
Awesome breakfast sandwiches.

Had a 1:1 business meeting here. My first visit and I loved it. The croissant was AMAZING. The sandwich as a whole could have been improved upon with more bacon and a little more cheese but I ate the whole thing anyway. The coffee is the kind that I seem to have a strange response to (gives me major brain fog) but it did have a good taste so if you don't have that problem, go for it. My friend bought me a snickerdoodle cookie which I ate later and it was delicious. I tend to prefer softer cookies but I'd definitely eat one again! Their scones looked amazing and I saw several people get them while I was there so that might be what I get next time. For a meeting place it was great and the wifi was spot on.
Excellent - great iced mocha and best banana chocolate chip muffin i ever had! Highly recommended
Outstanding coffee shop, better than the highly regarded Amelie's. Great coffee and outstanding pastries.
Perfectly fine food. Rude staff
Tried their vanilla bean cup cake at taste of Charlotte. It definitely is one of the best cupcakes I've had. The icing on the top had a very district flavor and taste.

I had a very tasty sandwich on freshly-made bread. There are many sandwich options and also many sweets to choose from. It's a cozy little restaurant with friendly staff. Parking is difficult on a crowded day; the spaces are tiny and limited.
Simple clean food with smooth coffee.
Mildly over priced but the quality is good.
Great bread but expensive.
Real croissants!  not something frozen out of a box.
I love this place! Cheddar Biscuit!!!
Awesome food! But the service is always awful! Not sure what's the deal... staff is never friendly... I have come here at least 10 times and it's always the same.

Have not had anything I didn't like here. It's a cozy little place to come have a good sandwich.  Their cheddar biscuits are sooo good and you can earn rewards and get free food if you come here a lot!
Great sweets and treats

This place does not disappoint. I could eat their almond croissants every single day. The chocolate croissants, ohhh so good. Their breakfast sandwiches on their cheddar biscuits?! So good. I can't say enough good things about their food. Yuuuum!!
This place - easily one of the best places, if not the best in CLT for great food and great coffee.
The staff is friendly and the coffee is delicious!
Superb area bakery. Great breakfast and lunch nook with fresh pastries and baked items. Nice selection of coffees and teas. Nice portions at an ample price. Not cheap.
I really want to like this place, but it always ends up bland.  I've never seen a willing male inside the place.  Also, parking is a riot.
I love this cozy little place! This morning I tried an Herbal tea with a croissant before work. The service was extremely friendly and fast. I'll definitely be a returning customer!

Reminds me a bit of Amelie's. The food is great, I had the avocado cheddar and egg croissant. You can tell that they make their own croissants, they're soft, flaky, and a little buttery. Oh, they have free wifi :) sorry forgot to take a picture, I was hungry
Great wifi, great coffee, and a warm cheddar biscuit is my go-to
A nice place to come for a little snack. really friendly stuff and tasty food.
Love this place. Amazing cheddar biscuits!
Never had anything bad from here.
Always friendly and always the best baked goods and lunches. Highly recommended!
Cheddar biscuits are great.
Bagels are great
Love this place. They don't always have bread available, but great when they do.
Awesome cookies and muffins! Not too sweet, just right.
Definitely somewhere to come for a yummy breakfast sandwich
The coffee was great and the Apple croissant very good.
Great bakery and coffee spot =)
I love it , kept the old tradition
Great atmosphere, slow service
Love the food and staff!
Sunflour Baking Company is such an adorable place. Perfect for some quiet studying with coffee or a nice lunch. They also make the most amazing croissants. Highly recommend!
Delicious sandwiches! Polite, friendly staff.
a must when you're in Elizabeth.
The cheese biscuits are excellent. Great place for getting dinner bread or deserts for special occasions.
We had the red velvet cupcake and it was moist &fresh. Lovely staff.
Best baked goods. Just have the Vegan Banna chip muffin
Great baked goods, fun atmosphere, terrific neighborhood stop,  a sign of how charlotte really is becoming a "real" city.
Management changed
The coffee was good and my breakfast sandwich was both delicious and larger than expected! The baked goods and lunch sandwich options also look great!
The owners are amazing, by far the best spot for a quaint meeting for business or lunch with a friend.
If you gave this place less than 5 stars I think you made a mistake.
Yum! Chocolate croissant was moist, flaky and delicious. Cheddar biscuit was like a meal itself.
Get your breakfast sandwich on a cheddar biscuit! Cinnamon rolls was moist and delicious. Don't miss this place on your next trip.
Great coffee and huge baked goods.
AWESOME bakery/sandwich shop...the blueberry & almond croissants are scrumptious. ...better than a Paris café! Charlotte's best kept secret...spread the word!

Sunflour is a gem. I think the baked goods are even better than Amelie's! Plus, they serve Pure Intentions AND Counter Culture coffee -- that alone would make them worth the trip. Prices are a little steep for a sandwich with no sides, but the delicious food, friendly staff, and excellent coffee make it a decent value, in my opinion. Try a cold brew coffee and a brioche cinnamon bun with cream cheese icing!
Love this bakery and the vegan friendly options!

Be still my croissant loving heart.. this place is delicious. Great for a lovely and casual breakfast or lunch. I highly recommend the breakfast sandwiches either on one of their banging croissants or a cheddar biscuit that will change your life. F those red lobster biscuits.. this is real. Have a party? Grab some cupcakes or a cake to go!
This is our go to bakery! We love it! Everything & everyone is wonderful here!
Good food, good coffee, good atmosphere. Love that I can walk here from home!

I tried the vanilla cupcake with buttercream icing. It didn't taste like what I was going for but it was ok. It tasted like a pound cake with icing. I wanted more of a normal cake/cupcake flavor. I'll have plenty more chances to try things off their menu. Check them out if you love sweets
The service was wonderful and the staff is so awesome and nice! The food was great, but the staff is just amazing. I loved it. Thanks y'all!
Everything is good. The cinnamon roll is awesome.
Love this location. So glad it's within walking distance. They have excellent coffee and amazing cheddar biscuits.
Yummy food.

I've never had not even a close to bad experience!  I frequent this wonderful establishment and the mor I go there the more I appreciate everyone who works on the TEAM of employees there!!  I think They actually care🤗about: first of all the quality of the goods they sell, each customer they serve, the team, each person they work with, the establishment at which they work and being happy with their jobs, which, by in large, I think is because of the owner!! All of these qualities put together makes them earn the ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ I give the restaurant.!  If you haven't been there, go give it a try, You will not be disappointed!! One happy customer, Teresa
BEST iced soy lattes and vegan raspberry whole wheat muffins!!!

The breakfast sandwiches are the best (especially if it's on a delicious, giant, cheddar cheese biscuit). Not a huge fan of their cupcakes(very dense and heavy)but their peanut butter and chocolate cookies, key lime tarts, and pumpkin whoopie pies are amazing!
Very good, but a bit on the expensive side for the type of food.

I visited this establishment yesterday, and it ended up being the most expensive sandwich I have ever ordered. I went into the establishment and ordered a $9.00 sandwich and cookie Togo. The strip mall has a tow and booting service called Wheel Blockers patrolling the parking lot to ensure no one is leaving the center and visiting any neighboring shops. The problem is I was a victim of this predatory practice they call business. Sunflour Baking Company has a small sign on the door stating if you leave the property then you are subjected to be towed or booted. However, I was not under the impression if I left the parking lot to pick up a Togo order simultaneously at Showmars this was applicable, especially since the attendant saw me park my car and order my food in Sunflour Baking Company. I was gone no more than 3 minutes if that. As I walked to my car I noticed a boot on my car, and the attendant who was held up in his 96 white Toyota Camery jumped on of his car which was parked two spaces from me and instructed me I have a boot on my car, like the 7 years I spent in school I could not decipher it was a boot. Then I begin to explain to him I had two Togo orders in the same area and it did not make sense to get in my car to drive across 7th street just to pick up the other order and I could show him my receipt proving I was a paying customer in Sunflour bakery. He said it was against the rules and I would have to pay 75.00 to get the boot off. As I reach for my credit card he then begins to tell me the price is now 85.00 which infuriates me because I was not understanding why the price jumped 10.00 in less than 10 seconds. Hes says its because they have a 10.00 credit card service fee, which I believe is completely bogus because they are not legally allowed to not accept any form of US currency. Anyways, he points to the Friendly Mart across the street and says I can use their ATM. As I am trying to pay this man the 75.00 he is no where to be found because he is at HoHo Cherry House picking up his Togo food. I guess my questions is Sunflour and other business in the shop are paying Wheel Blockers to service their parking lot to ensure paying customers do not leave but he is taking breaks during his allotted work hours to purchase Chinese food. How do they know during his stretch in HoHo no one else walked across the street and abandon their cars for much longer than 3 minutes because their parking lot attendant was taking personal breaks during his work shift, questioning how often he is accountable for enforcing this rule? Also no where on any of these parking lot signs does it give pricing, enforcing a bigger issue of price gauging could be taking place as his pricing fluctuated. The attendant was unbelievably rude and I will never be purchasing anything again from this company again. I live less than .7 of a mile away and I would rather drive to Noda, Dillworth, South End, or Plaza where I am free to eat bonbons, croissants sub sandwiches, Jamaican, and burger without fear I am going to be towed. In total this trip to my local bakery costed me 90.00, wow for that price I could have bought a Steak from Del Frisco or Ruth Chris. No offense but shop local is always stressing shop local, but with your customer base being treated like this, haha I have to question what standards of loyalty one has.

Really good breakfast. They are kinda slow for a counter Servcie place (taking about 15-20 min to get your food). The cheese biscuits are really good. They also have giant cinimon rolls that would have been nice if they reheated before they served them to you.
Order one of everything, or keep coming back until you do! The cheddar biscuits are amazing!

I paid 20$ for the avacado melt, a cookie, cupcake and ice tea. The melt was good, the dark chocolate salted cookie was tasty, thick and kind of Cakey and the cupcake was yummy but I had to wipe off most of the icing. It's delicious but too sweet and overpowering. Other than that yea it was good. Not smack yo mama good or anything but definitely a cute place to grab lunch with a girl friend or your mom :)
Croissants a bit over cooked for my taste but their french press and cheddar biscuits are fantastic.

Every baked good I have had here has been wonderful. The croissants are buttery and crispy just as they should be, and the cupcakes are the best I've tasted in or out of town - perfect and real tasting.
great, great baked goods.. OMG you can't go wrong here.. the morning glory muffin is my top favorite. I can't give this 5 stars.. needs something else to really gel..

The pastries are out of control; head and shoulders above anything else in town. The rest of the baked goods are above par at worst and delicious at best. The coffee is second only to Not Just Coffee, but a better experience because you're always going to receive it from a friendly face. The place is clean, comfortable, unpretentious, and there's plenty of parking. I only wish it were closer.
The caramel cupcake is flawless. They have real food too...
Hands down the best bakery in Charlotte.

After dining here on three separate occasions, I can confidently say I will never return. While the clean, spacious interior, and neat chalkboard menu looks appealing, the reality is far from it. On all three occasions, the place was nearly empty, and my order took over 15 minutes. Two of the three times my order was wrong, be it the type of bread or meat I chose. While I understand that "all natural, organic" ingredients cost more, over $6 for a meager breakfast sandwich is still not justified. There is a difference between paying more for quality and flat out overpriced. They have absolutely no condiments either for their rather bland food. I have also tried some of their "gourmet" baked goods, and was flat out unimpressed. I am not normally one to complain, but after multiple subpar experiences at this establishment, I feel the overwheming need to warn potential customers before they waste their time and money.
Always tasty, always fresh, Great coffee and prices are ok. Costumer service is fantastic.
